thread.title: Game 3 lineups: Chase Utley not starting for Dodgers - neither is Corey Seager
thread.title_full: Game 3 lineups: Chase Utley not starting for Dodgers - neither is Corey Seager

title: Game 3 lineups: Chase Utley not starting for Dodgers - neither is Corey Seager
text:
NEW YORK -- A marked man after his controversial takeout slide in Game 2, Chase Utley is not in the Dodgers' starting lineup for Game 3 of their National League Division Series against the New York Mets.
Utley was suspended for Games 3 and 4 of the NLDS by MLB's chief baseball officer, Joe Torre, for what Torre referred to as "an illegal slide" which resulted in a fractured right fibula for Mets shortstop Ruben Tejada. But Utley is appealing the suspension and will be eligible to play until he has a hearing with MLB.
Utley released a statement through his agent, Joel Wolfe, Monday afternoon.
"The Players Association and my agent are handling the appeals process," Utley said. "I have nothing more to say other than to reiterate that I feel terrible about Ruben's injury. Now my teammates and I are focused on Game 3 and doing everything we can to win this series."
Before word of Utley's suspension Sunday, Dodgers manager Don Mattingly said it was "definitely a possibility" that he would have Utley in the starting lineup for Game 3. Utley is 6 for 18 with a double and a home run in his career off the Mets' Game 3 starter Matt Harvey.
Mets manager Terry Collins acknowledged he was a little surprised Utley was not starting given his history against Harvey and the Mets. Collins suggested Utley might still be feeling the effects of Saturday's collision with Tejada.
"Don knows his team better than me. But I got the same stats he's got and I know he (Utley) swings the bat pretty good against Matt Harvey," Collins said. "After I saw the replay several times of the play at second, he's lucky he didn't get hurt because he took a pretty good shot. So maybe that's an effect, too. Something may be stiff or whatever.
"But I know ... he has a knack of beating us somehow. So let him sit over on the bench for eight innings."
Mattingly confirmed Sunday that Utley was checked for a concussion after Game 2 but he was deemed "fine."
Tonight's lineups:
DODGERS (1-1) 
2B Howie Kendrick
SS Jimmy Rollins
1B Adrian Gonzalez
3B Justin Turner
RF Andre Ethier
LF Carl Crawford
C Yasmani Grandal
CF Kike' Hernandez
LHP Brett Anderson
METS (1-1) 
RF Curtis Granderson
3B David Wright
2B Daniel Murphy
LF Yoenis Cespedes
1B Lucas Duda
C Travis d'Arnaud
SS Wilmer Flores
CF Juan Lagares
RHP Matt Harvey
